cookies: To function properly this website needs to store data on your device. By continuing to use it you acknowlegde and accept that data is stored on your device.

home.release_info: Paper and Data will be released on 5 / 5 / 2020, at 5:05 PM (EST)
home.intro: The COVID-19 is a pandemic of humongous human and economic consequences. We have developed an AI algorithm that can help identify useful targets for a vaccine against COVID-19.
home.because: Testing vaccines is a very lengthy process and patient samples are rare, fragile and precious. By making our results public, our goal is to significantly reduce the pool of targets to be tested, thus accelerating the development of a vaccine.
home.publishing_takes_time: Publishing scientific findings takes months. Given the urgency of the situation, we have decided to make our results freely available as rapidly as possible.
home.under_construction: You can follow the latest developments on Twitter

research.title: Unveiling the weaknesses of SARS-CoV-2
research.intro: The AI algorithm we use is called CAMAP and was developed at the {IRIC} during Tariq Daouda's PhD. The original application for CAMAP was cancer immunotherapy. However, because it has learned general patterns about the immune system, CAMAP can also unveil virus weaknesses. These weaknesses are very small bits of viral proteins that infected cells present at their surface. These bits are called epitopes, and because these epitopes are like red flags waved by infected cells and then used by the immune system to fight the virus, they can be used in a vaccine. Epitope vaccines are also in theory safer because they do not contain the whole virus. CAMAP can help identify which of these epitopes will be useful to create a vaccine against SARS-CoV-2.
research.tariq_ivado_video: In this short clip from 2019, Tariq Daouda talks to {IVADO} about the most important ideas behind CAMAP.

about.team_intro: Epitopes.world is made and maintained by a multi-disciplinary team of researchers and developpers. We are committed to share science openly and to develop innovative ways of instantly disseminating research results when timing is crucial.
about.acknowlegments_intro: These people do not directly participate to Epitopes.world, however we would like to thank them for their significant contributions.
